parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: Properly, to stare at, i.e. to discern clearly; by extension, to attend to; by Hebraism, to experience; passively, to appear.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Accusative Masculine Singular
Verb - Present Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To love, wish well to, take pleasure in, long for; denotes the love of reason, esteem. Perhaps from agan; to love.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: Properly, to stare at, i.e. to discern clearly; by extension, to attend to; by Hebraism, to experience; passively, to appear.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Accusative Masculine Singular

str2: Now, just now, at this moment. Adverb from a derivative of airo through the idea of suspension; just now.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: From pistis; to have faith, i.e. Credit; by implication, to entrust.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To exult, be full of joy. From agan and hallomai; properly, to jump for joy, i.e. Exult.
Unspeakable. Not spoken out, i.e. unutterable.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Dative Feminine Singular
str2: To glorify, honor, bestow glory on. From doxa; to render glorious.
Joy, gladness, a source of joy. From chairo; cheerfulness, i.e. Calm delight.
